I assume there is a shuttle service to the airport; however, we ended up driving and parking in the hotel's outdoor lot. With respect to parking, the Renaissance charges far too much to park in this area of the city. They are charging downtown Toronto rates in the suburbs which I find outrageous. I have no problem paying high rates in a central location but an airport hotel should have rates of $12 (or less) per day. Everything else about the hotel was great, and we were able to use the hotel's closeness to the 427 and 401 highways to visit tourist sites in Toronto during our stay. The drive to downtown Toronto takes about 20 minutes depending on the traffic. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel but we only used the bar in the evening. The hotel bar is very nice with a modern design thoughout. Usually airport hotel bars are a real drag, but we had a great time! There is also an Outback Steakhouse and Montana's restaurant on either side of the hotel, so you should have no problem finding a good place to grab some food. I would recommend a stay at the Renaissance and would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel which was a Hotwire 4star booking. Very impressed. Entrance and lobby - modern and spacious - are an indication of the entire hotel. Staff are welcoming and helpful. Room is spacious - except for the bathroom and closet. However, the bathroom has been renovated; they've made the most of it. My king bed room was not overwhelmed by the bed; there were 2 upholstered chairs - one with ottoman. Nice size desk. New windows that have a slot for fresh air. Everything about the room seemed new and upbeat, including the comforter and carpet. Planes fly directly overhead. However, the noise wasn't that bad. Certainly wasn't disruptive. I should have put my don't disturb sign out - I had a houskeeping knock at 8am. The 24 hour fitness room has all new equipment. The pool is open 6am-11pm. It has a glass dome, and is mostly deeper water. There was a whirlpool out of service. The nice thing - everything is clean and freshly painted. Business centre has 2 PC's and another spot to plug in your laptop. All free - and you can even use the printer. The is a convenience/gift shop onsite. I found the hotel a nice change from the Sheraton Gateway - which seems lifeless in comparison. Free airport shuttle runs every 30 mins. Olio Mediterrean Grill is onsite. On the sides of the hotel are Outback Steakhouse and Montana's Cookhouse. Across and over are Boston Pizza, Tuckers Marketplace (buffet; I will not return) and Tona Roma's. Two more restaurants are under construction, including a Jack Astor Bar & Grill. If you walk for about 15 minutes east (on the Hwy 27 Dixon Rd overpass), you'll be at Tim Horton's, Swiss Chalet, Milestones, Harvey's, and a convenience store. Those are all across from the Doubletree International Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: bitride
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire, this was very good value. Stayed 3 nights on this trip. Would stay there again. The lobby and check-in staff were both nice. Elevators are quick. The room was nice overall and clean. The windows were large and had slots that could be opened for fresh air if desired. The closet could use improvement, it's small and the door not easy to open, but I didn't really need it, the hutch drawers were enough. The desk was a good height and size, and the high speed internet was good. Two comfortable chairs provided a place to sit down. The format of having the TV face the bed is awkward, even with the sliding/angling TV mount. There's a nice restaurant on-site for meals, but there's also lots of chain restaurants within a kilometer or two for variety and ease on the wallet. Parking was $14 per day, but at least there's no in-out restrictions. The staff were all polite, and go above and beyond if there's any problems. There was some plane noise as one of the runways has them coming directly overhead for landing, but I found it easily ignored, and not noticeable at night.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: michiganonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night last weekend. The hotel is extremely clean, very new, the staff were great, and there were great amenities in the hotel. The downsides - you can hear a fair amount of airplace noise (from airplanes flying overhead) even while you're in your room, and the bathroom was pretty small. The closet is also very small. Other than that, this was a great place to stay. It's very accessible from the 401.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jayneoliz
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the city, it costs more but is worth it to stay downtown. If you're looking for an airport hotel, this is a good choice. Everything about this hotel was pleasent, comfortable and gracious. The restaurant was unusually good, the decor was updated, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom ammenities were lovely. The only thing I could say that would come close to being a complaint is that the bathroom itself could have been more interestingly decorated. The free shuttle to the airport and park-n-fly rate were very convenient and cost-effective.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: savystayer
Reviews.Content: My first time in an airport hotel and i was suprised. Very spacious rooms, great facilities ( including a laundry room - much cheaper than hotel service laundry ! ) Very close to airport in decent area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: goffsteve
Reviews.Content: If you're going to spend time in Toronto, you're going to want to stay downtown. But if you have to stay near the airport, this is a great choice. Five-minute shuttle ride to and from the terminal, excellent restaurant, nice modern rooms, friendly staff, easy parking, adequate restaurants nearby, indoor pool, conference center. For an airport hotel, this place stands out. I stayed for $105 (US) on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: PogoJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in both June and July 2007. It is a great all 'round hotel if you need to be near the Toronto Intl Airport. Good rooms and common areas, excellent meeting/conference facilities, terrific food and a very modern menu, excellent food services for meetings, and generally great staff. The Sheraton is best if you want to be really close to the Airport -- it's just a short ride on the monorial from Terminal 1 and connected to Terminal 3 -- but if you don't need to be that close, the Renaissance is your best alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: thenay84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favourites, and is in a good location as well. The only downfall to this hotel is the $14CAD parking fee per night, however this is expected considering it's near the airport. The noise from the planes flying above you will hardly notice if at all. The pool is great too, and is deep unlike many pools at hotels. I believe it was 8-9ft deep! The gym was nice, not too big however but was clean and had new machines to work out with.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: A-Postel
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Toronto and this was my first time in the Renaissance. It's a good hotel, but I will go with Sheraton again, despite the price difference, because off the different and more vivant ambiance there. Service is ok, room big enough. Couldn't always get into business lounge though, despite the fact that I booked a room on the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mentaltraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January and February, and have now booked three more stays later this year. I'm so glad I stopped staying at the Sheraton! The Renaissance is welcoming, well organized, friendly, helpful--and the food--buffet breakfast and tapas in the restaurant--is superb! Fresh, original, healthy, hot, delicious. The decor is relaxing and intriguing. The rooms are large, clean, well appointed--and restful. I was concerned about the hotel shuttle--whether that extra trip from the airport would be just too much after a long flight and with tons of luggage (5 suitcases)--but it is great. Easy enough. To date, hotel shuttle is very reliable and very regular. It is no extra burden than having to take the sky train or inner aiport terminal shuttle to the Sheraton Gateway in Terminal 3. And you get a much better experience when you arrive at the Renaissance--excellent and prompt check-in staff. And valets on check out actually know something about luggage and transport! No struggle or drama. A great Toronto hotel, not just a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights and absolutely loved it! The staffs were very friendly and helpfull. This hotel has a modern decor, nice and bright. The room is quite roomy, lot of storage space. Our room and all public area were very well kept. We at first were concern with the air trafic but once you're in the room, it's not very noticeable. The only problem we had were coffe supplies were not replenish daily. We also asked for some extra bath towers but never get them. For that I give it a 4 instead of a 5 star rating. Will definitelly stay there again if we come to Toronto.
